title: Broccoli and Carrot Stir Fry Recipe
description: Broccoli and carrots are stir-fried in peanut oil in this quick and easy Chinese stir-fry dish that is great by itself or served with meat.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Chinese Broccoli and Carrot Stir Fry 4.6 (9) 9 Reviews 5 Photos A simple and healthy side dish that will go well with any meal. It's also quick and easy to make! Broccoli, carrots, and seasonings are stir-fried to perfection. Submitted by Chelsea Updated on November 16, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 16 mins Total Time: 26 mins Servings: 5 Yield: 5 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 5 servings 5 ½ cups broccoli florets 1 carrot, thinly sliced 2 teaspoons water 1 teaspoon cornstarch 1 teaspoon chicken bouillon granules, or to taste salt to taste 2 tablespoons peanut oil Directions Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add broccoli and cook uncovered until bright green, about 2 minutes. Transfer broccoli to a bowl of ice water using a slotted spoon and immerse for several minutes to stop the cooking process. Drain. Bring water back to a boil in the same large pot; add sliced carrot and cook for 1 minute. Drain. Mix water and cornstarch together in a bowl until smooth. Add chicken granules and salt and mix well. Heat peanut oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat; saute broccoli and carrots for 2 minutes. Add cornstarch mixture; cook and stir until vegetables are coated evenly, 1 to 2 minutes. Add Your Photo Photos of Broccoli and Carrot Stir Fry 01 of 05 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 05 Photo by  Lori 03/16/2020 Delicious! I cooked the broccoli & carrots together in the microwave for 3 minutes and they were fine. I used garlic infused oil and added a large, cooked chicken breast left over from last night’s dinner. Stirred them all together in the pan and cooked a cup of instant brown rice in the microwave. So easy, and pretty healthy, too! Maybe I didn’t use enough broccoli, but there’s no way this would feed 5. 03 of 05 Photo by  Stephanie Pass 01/22/2020 04 of 05 Photo by  Andrea Q 03/02/2018 Quick, easy and flavorful! kids approved ;) 1 You’ll Also Love Hunan Peppered Pork 3 Ratings Green Onion Cakes 86 Ratings Steamed Garlic Prawns, Chinese Style 12 Ratings Chinese Eggplant with Garlic Sauce 288 Ratings Chicken and Chinese Vegetable Stir-Fry 105 Ratings Stir-Fried Chicken With Pineapple and Peppers 115 Ratings Chinese Take-Out Shrimp with Garlic 46 Ratings Black Pepper Beef and Cabbage Stir Fry 780 Ratings Fried Prawns in Soy Sauce 1 Rating Taiwanese Dumplings 5 Ratings Sweet and Spicy Pork and Napa Cabbage Stir-Fry with Spicy Noodles 161 Ratings Chicken Fried Rice 2,083 Ratings Stir-Fried Chicken with Tofu and Mixed Vegetables 16 Ratings Beefy Chinese Dumplings 95 Ratings Malaysian Lady Fingers (Okra) 1 Rating Cindi's Egg Rolls 104 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Chelsea
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add broccoli and cook uncovered until bright green, about 2 minutes. Transfer broccoli to a bowl of ice water using a slotted spoon and immerse for several minutes to stop the cooking process. Drain.;Bring water back to a boil in the same large pot; add sliced carrot and cook for 1 minute. Drain.;Mix water and cornstarch together in a bowl until smooth. Add chicken granules and salt and mix well.;Heat peanut oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat; saute broccoli and carrots for 2 minutes. Add cornstarch mixture; cook and stir until vegetables are coated evenly, 1 to 2 minutes.
